document.title: Class View and Object Browser Classes

paragraph.paragraph: Classes are the equivalent of .NET types. The classes shown come in two varieties; compiled and not compiled. Compiled classes are indicated by a blue ../images/class/class.ico icon and uncompiled classes, which are those that have not been compiled into a project because they are not reachable from the ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlroot class, are shown as a gray ../images/class/class_not_in_system.ico icon.
Class folders will be located directly under clusters.xmlCluster Folders and other class statuary browsing features, as contained in this document.

Expanding compiled class folders displays much more information regarding the class, its ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/20_language/20_adding_class_features.xmlfeatures, ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlancestors and ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmldescendents.

Ancestors
../images/class/hier_class_ancestors.ico
A tree of ancestor classes inherited by the expanded class.

Descendents
../images/class/hier_class_descendents.ico
A tree of known descending classes, inheriting the expanded class.

Clients
../images/class/hier_class_clients.ico
A tree of classes that refer to the expanded class using a ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclient relationship.

Suppliers
../images/class/hier_class_suppliers.ico
A tree of classes the expanded class is a ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclient of using a ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlsupplier relationship.

Creation Routines
../images/feature/hier_feature_creators.ico
A tree of declared ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlcreation routines of the expanded class.

Inherited Features
../images/feature/hier_feature_inherited.ico
A flattened view of all of the expanded class's inherited ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlfeatures, inherited from ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlancestor classes.

All Features
../images/feature/hier_feature_all.ico
A flattened view of all of the expanded class's ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlfeatures merged with the features of any ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlancestor classes.

All of the folders succeeding All Features are the ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlfeatures of the expanded class. Their icons and meanings are explained in the ../icon_glossary.xmlEiffel Icons section of this documentation.

If you need to direct the ../../eiffel_editor/index.xmlEiffel Editor to any class found in the index.xmlClass View, a double-left mouse click on a corresponding class folder will open the ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlEiffel class in the editor of the relevant class source in view. Note: The index.xmlClass View will show .NET types when using the facilities to browse classes.xmlclass and feature ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlancestors, ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmldescendents, etc. Attempts to locate the related source will instead open the ../object_browser/index.xmlObject Browser and locate the appropriate folder given the assembly, type and feature.
